github.jcext

Interface Enqueuer.Poller<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    Enclosing class:
    Enqueuer<T>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public static interface Enqueuer.Poller<T>
    Asynchronous single consumer of queued items. Enqueuer guarantees that pollAsync(Queue) method will never run concurrently.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<?> pollAsync(java.util.Queue<T> queue)
      This method will be scheduled for execution, only if the queue is not empty.
      static <T> Enqueuer.Poller<T> pollByChunk(int maxChunkSize, java.util.function.Function<java.util.List<T>,java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<?>> receiverFun) 
      static <T> Enqueuer.Poller<T> pollByOne(java.util.function.Function<T,java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<?>> receiverFun) 

    • Method Detail

      • pollAsync

        java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<?> pollAsync(java.util.Queue<T> queue)
        This method will be scheduled for execution, only if the queue is not empty. At least one queue.poll() must return non-null.

        This method will be never called concurrently, UNTIL its resultant CompletionStage is completed. It must be non-blocking.

        It may return null, which is interpreted as CompletableFuture.completedFuture(Object)

        Never save the reference to the queue parameter anywhere, use it only inside async computation of this method. (i.e. you should not keep/use the queue after the resultant CompletionStage is completed)

      • pollByOne

        static <T> Enqueuer.Poller<T> pollByOne(java.util.function.Function<T,java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<?>> receiverFun)

      • pollByChunk

        static <T> Enqueuer.Poller<T> pollByChunk(int maxChunkSize,
                                          java.util.function.Function<java.util.List<T>,java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<?>> receiverFun)
